info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:13AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, south central Fulton, Schoharie and Montgomery Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 312 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jefferson, or 14 miles southwest of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gust around 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Canajoharie, Fonda, Jefferson, Duanesburg, Fort Plain, Ephratah, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Ames, Breakabeen, North Blenheim, Tribes Hill, Central Bridge, Glen and Carlisle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
